name: Cook Inlet Tribal Council (CITC) Tech Programs
description: CITC offers tech programs aimed at empowering Alaska Native and American Indian individuals, including an affordable coding bootcamp that teaches essential programming languages and incorporates cultural connections

name: Codefy Foundation
address: While a physical address is not readily available, they focus on serving Native American and Alaska Native communities

name: Alaska STEAM Hub (Benteh STEAM Academy)

name: Alaska Tech Learners (ATL)
address: Operates through Prince William Sound College, with courses delivered via thumb drives to rural students
description: This project prepares rural Alaska students, primarily Native Alaskans, to become technician-level web engineers through an asynchronous, dual enrollment program. The curriculum is Alaska-themed and delivered in a way that respects historical learning methods
services: American-Indian-owned Coding classes in Alaska consultation

description: An educator at Alak School teaches computer science to 7th graders, using platforms like Code.org to introduce problem-solving and critical thinking skills, with a focus on empowering Alaska Native students

name: Lone Eagle Consulting (Alaska Native Innovations Incubator)

description: This initiative aims to create a statewide online entrepreneurship training center for Alaska Native entrepreneurs, which includes digital innovation and online resource creation, potentially involving coding skills
